Item.text: Take part in creating more language packs for Device Monitoring Studio

This language pack was created by open source community. We do not hold any responsibility on the quality of this translation.\r\n\r\nIf you have found a mistake in a translation, you may submit a ticket or correct it yourself.

Message.value: You need to restart Device Monitoring Studio after changing the language. Do you want to restart now?
Your current session will be paused.

If you would like to be notified of the status of your crash report submission and want your reports to be processed with higher priority, please provide your e-mail address in the box below. Your e-mail address will not be used for anything else beyond discussion of your submission.

Minidumps usually have a size less than a megabyte and contain only limited information about a crash. Sometimes a minidump is enough to diagnose the problem, but often it lacks necessary information required to reproduce the crash.

Full dumps contain the compressed view of all process address space. They are best to allow developers to reproduce the situation that caused the crash and fix it as soon as possible. However, the size of a full dump may easily reach hundreds of megabytes.
